name: The Resurrection of Jesus
shortDescription: Did Jesus really rise from the dead?
longDescription: Jesus of Nazareth is the most important figure in human history. He claimed to be the unique Son of God and the Messiah of the world. The Bible records accounts of his triumphant resurrection. But can a man really rise from the dead? Are the claims about Jesus's resurrection true?

links.displayText: N.T. Wright - Jesus' Resurrection and Christian Origins

name: Who was Paul the Apostle
shortDescription: Describes the life and ministry of Saul of Tarsus (later Paul)
longDescription: Many claims have been made about the man Saul of Tarsus. Some hold that he was the "inventor" of Christianity, while others believe him to have been a secret Roman spy. But who was Saul of Tarsus really? Did he really have a miraculous conversion at Damascus? What did he (now Paul) actually write about?

links.displayText: InspiringPhilosophy - Could Paul Arrest Christians in Damascus?

name: The Synoptic Gospels
shortDescription: Dives into the reliability and truth of Matthew, Mark, and Luke
longDescription: The Synoptic Gospels (Matthew, Mark, and Luke) are 1st century accounts that describe the life and ministry of Jesus of Nazareth. Some skeptical scholars question the truthfullness of the synoptics, largely from presuppositions about the Resurrection being false. But do their claims have any merit? Are there contradictions in the Synoptic Gospels? Were they really written by Matthew, Mark, and Luke?

links.displayText: InspiringPhilosophy - The Reliability of the Gospels
